intro: Moscharia asperidifolia, commonly known as the rough-leaved moscharia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, hairy leaves that are often arranged in a basal rosette, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, and they bloom in late summer to early autumn. Moscharia asperidifolia is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun.
